commit.message:
Add test duration argument and numerous other improvements

Notable changes:
- Adds -d parameter meaning test's duration
  - 0 = infinite test duration, lasts until user manually closes the
    stage
  - Tests execute for provided amount of seconds + 5 seconds warmup
    time. Warmup time is not included in performance measurement.
  - FPS report from test uses provided test duration only if test fully
    completed, otherwise FPS is calculated from actual time elapsed
- Tests will now properly close and stop executing when manually closing
  the stage
- Removed Particles class and moved its logic to ParticleRenderable.
  This allows the tests to have a bit more freedom in how to interpret
  the test arguments + prevents variable duplication (ex. object count)
  - MultiShape tests now round up object count to 4

Migrate base version of RenderPerfTest

Co-authored-by: Karthik P K <karthik.p.k@oracle.com>
